question.text: A mixture of <math><mn>250</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></math> of water and <math><mn>200</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></math> of ice at <math><mn>0</mn><mo>°</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> is kept in a calorimeter of water equivalent <math><mn>50</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></math>. If <math><mn>200</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></math> of steam at <math><mn>100</mn><mo>°</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> is passed through the mixture then the final amount of water in the mixture will be (Latent Heat of ice = <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>80</mn><mo> </mo></math> <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>cal</mi><mo> </mo><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math>, Latent Heat of vaporisation of water = <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>540</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi></math><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>cal</mi><mo> </mo><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> and specific heat of water = <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>1</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mo> </mo><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo>/</mo><mo>°</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> )

solution.text:
Heat required by ice to melt =200×80=16000 cal

Heat required by 250 g water
(ice + initial water + calorimeter) to raise up to 100°C

=500×1×100=50000 cal

⇒ Total heat required =16000+50000=66000 cal

Let m g of steam condenses, then

66000=m×540

⇒  m≈122g

So final amount of water =450+122=572 g
